paragraphs.body: I have a question: what's the difference between featured article and featured fanon?  - Kai - Talk 20:07, 27 February 2009 (UTC)
paragraphs.text: I have a question: what's the difference between featured article and featured fanon?  - Kai - Talk 20:07, 27 February 2009 (UTC)

paragraphs.body: I don't think we have enough content to showcase twice for one month. Maybe if the time was longer or there was only one Featured thing, but not both. Or maybe that's what you had in mind and I'm just reading too much into it.
paragraphs.text: I don't think we have enough content to showcase twice for one month. Maybe if the time was longer or there was only one Featured thing, but not both. Or maybe that's what you had in mind and I'm just reading too much into it.

paragraphs.body: I think for navigation and practical purposes this should be moved to the project namespace like the other featured content voting pages. It should be in my opinion split between "Avatar Wiki:Featured Fanon/Voting" and "Avatar Wiki:Featured Fanon Article/Voting". This would reduce the learning curve for any new user. Wjxhuang, the 888th Avatar {Talk} 14:58, 29 June 2009 (UTC)

paragraphs.body: I agree completely. Vaznock - Talk 15:03, 29 June 2009 (UTC)
paragraphs.text: I agree completely. Vaznock - Talk 15:03, 29 June 2009 (UTC)

paragraphs.body: Do you mind if I rename "Avatar Wiki:Featured Fanon" to "Avatar Wiki:Featured Fanon Content", I just figured if there is a Featured Fanon Article, then there should be a Featured Fanon Content. Zukofan - Talk 19:25, 1 July 2009 (UTC)
paragraphs.text: Do you mind if I rename "Avatar Wiki:Featured Fanon" to "Avatar Wiki:Featured Fanon Content", I just figured if there is a Featured Fanon Article, then there should be a Featured Fanon Content. Zukofan - Talk 19:25, 1 July 2009 (UTC)

paragraphs.body: "Any user is welcome to come and cast a vote about what they think should be a featured article and a featured fanon! What is that? Pretty much, it's an article that stands up to the policy of the wiki, has good grammar, nice setup, images, templates, etc. So enjoy!"
paragraphs.text: "Any user is welcome to come and cast a vote about what they think should be a featured article and a featured fanon! What is that? Pretty much, it's an article that stands up to the policy of the wiki, has good grammar, nice setup, images, templates, etc. So enjoy!"

paragraphs.body: I think that we should significantly change the wording here.  Look at the intro description for ${link_0}.  It sounds clean-cut and professional.  This, well...doesn't.  I think we can do better. --AvatarRokus Ghost (Message me • Read my fanon)   00:44, November 23, 2011 (UTC)
paragraphs.text: I think that we should significantly change the wording here.  Look at the intro description for User of the Month.  It sounds clean-cut and professional.  This, well...doesn't.  I think we can do better. --AvatarRokus Ghost (Message me • Read my fanon)   00:44, November 23, 2011 (UTC)

paragraphs.body: I think this page should be archived monthly so that at the beginning of every month its always blank. If we want more people to participate in this, its better to not have the previous months right above it as a distraction. This page was always a pain to scroll down to the right spot when it had a year and a half's worth of voting on it. --AvatarRokus Ghost (Message me • Read my fanon)   07:20, January 2, 2012 (UTC)

paragraphs.body: "For both the featured series and the featured article, a minimum of five people must cast their votes for the chosen fanon to be featured." Well, obviously that hasn't been happening lately. I don't think the rule should be there anymore because as the last months have shown, it isn't actually necessary. Plus, if we did follow the rule, what would happen if nothing got five votes in one month, like what is happening currently in June? BlackMonkey Talk - Fire & Ice 17:03, June 30, 2012 (UTC)
paragraphs.text: "For both the featured series and the featured article, a minimum of five people must cast their votes for the chosen fanon to be featured." paragraphs.body: Hey, folks.  I would like to propose a new rule, not change the whole rule at all.  Can we add one more rule; It's prohibited to A nominate B and B nominate A in same month, same category? It's not fair if A and B switching nominations. ^^"  No offense to everyone. Acer Evan  Seek anything about fanon!  09:03, August 22, 2012 (UTC)
paragraphs.text: Hey, folks.  I would like to propose a new rule, not change the whole rule at all. paragraphs.body:
Ummm, if a chapter of a Fanon series has been featured for Fanon article, can that Fanon series be featured in the other category?
-- Wiki Geek  15:19, February 2, 2013 (UTC)
paragraphs.text:

paragraphs.body: If there is only one nomination for either featured fanon series or featured fanon article, yet they don't receive five votes by the end of the month, do they not get advertised/win/whatever we call it? Does there need to be competition/enough community support?
